Courses

Gender-Based Violence CPD Training for Staff

This CPD course relates to the UK Relationships and Sex Education curriculum. The ideas contained support the development of an inclusive school culture and further teachers’ understanding of how to teach what a healthy relationship should look like.

Cards

  • Our courses

    If you’re looking for a trusted courses for your parents, pupils and staff, The Wellbeing Hub is designed by experts to meet the social, emotional and educational needs of young people.

  • Resources

    If you’re looking for a trusted courses for your parents, pupils and staff, The Wellbeing Hub is designed by experts to meet the social, emotional and educational needs of young people.

  • Webinars & Talks

    We can deliver live Webinars and Talks on a range of topics, for pupils, parents and staff. And we can provide you with recorded talks to show at Parents Events.

  • Learning Materials

    Access Videos, Lesson Plans and Resources, to play to pupils in class. We are regularly adding modules on different topics, for different year groups.

Mental HealthParents

Featured Content

Podcast

My Experience of Living with a Parent with a Mental Illness

With: Rochelle Watson

Rochelle Watson, a young person who was supported by the Our Time Charity, shares her story of living with a parent with a mental illness. Rochelle shares her advice for young people who find themselves in a similar situation, how to navigate stigma and everyday discrimination, and how to deal with peer rejection and social isolation in the context of mental illness. This is an honest, thought-provoking conversation which we hope will offer some insight into the experiences of children and young people with mental illness in the family.

Mental HealthMental Illness
Resources

Parental Mental Illness

With: Dympna Cunnane

We invited Dympna Cunnane, a psychologist and the Chief Executive of the Our Time Charity, to discuss parental mental illness and how to support families in need. Dympna shares her advice for parents with poor mental health on how to talk to their children about their illness. We also discuss the challenges faced by children, how schools can help, and finally, what support parents and children need.

Mental HealthAnxiety
Resources

Managing Negative Thought Patterns

With: Clare Nicholas

To mark Mental Health Awareness Week 2022, we thought we’d share this blog written by Clare Nicholas on negative thought patterns. Clare shares her advice on how to manage negative thought patterns, practise self-care, and notice your positive attributes. This is a great one to share with your child/pupils.

Access the staff course

Gender-Based Violence Training

This CPD course relates to the UK Relationships and Sex Education curriculum. The ideas contained support the development of an inclusive school culture and further teachers’ understanding of how to teach what a healthy relationship should look like.

Access this CPD training

Our Complete Parenting Courses

Children don’t arrive with a handbook, and even if they did it would quickly become obsolete once they hit adolescence. Our parenting courses will help you create a happy home life and give you tools for when drama strikes.

Access the parenting courses

Parent Events Talks

These talks are designed to help you create a good working alliance with parents and carers. Each video is approximately 15 minutes long, making them perfect to screen at parent events.

View the talks
